data.name: Buckin' Bitter
data.description: There are three different recognized styles of Bitter Ale: Ordinary Bitter, Best Bitter & Extra Special Bitter (ESB). The only noticeable difference in these styles is the level of Hop presence. Buckin' Bitter is an Ordinary Style bitter.  Brewed with crystal and caramel malted barley this beer features moderate sweetness and a noticeable hop character. Slightly bitter with a bit of floral hop aroma this is a good introduction to the more robust English ale styles we brew.

style.name: Ordinary Bitter
style.description: Ordinary bitter is gold to copper colored with medium bitterness, light to medium body, and low to medium residual malt sweetness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character and very low diacetyl (butterscotch) character are acceptable in aroma and flavor, but should be minimized in this form of bitter. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

breweries.name: Wind River Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Wind River Brewing Company is located at the base of the Wind River Mountains in downtown Pinedale, Wyoming. Our brewery is the spot for those who appreciate the art of handcrafted superior brews with a wide range of flavors and notes. We brew award winning beers, created in-house using only the finest ingredients and pure glacier water.

"We are known for having legendary beer and the best food in town." If you're looking for a quick bite to eat or want to relax and sample our entire selection of beer we welcome you to join us at Wind River Brewing Co.

breweries.name: Acorn Brewery of Barnsley
breweries.description:
Established in May 2003 by former chef Dave Hughes and his wife Judi, Acorn Brewery is located to the east of the Pennines in the village of Wombwell, Barnsley.

Having worked for Barnsley Brewery as Head Brewer for two years, Dave decided to go it alone, purchased a ten barrel brewplant from the Forester & Firkin brewpub in Stafford and moved it to premises in Wombwell.

 Following a lot of hard work by Dave and his assistant brewer Steve Bunting, and despite some initial set backs, the brewplant was commissioned and production of Acorn Brewery Barnsley Bitter began on 4th July 2003, using the same yeast strain as the original Barnsley Brewery, founded in the 1850's. Since then, sales have grown steadily and the range of beers has increased.

Acorn Brewery has developed a popular Yorkshire brand and is currently supplying over 300 free trade outlets and 3 national wholesalers.  

There are currently three award-winning beers permanently available, as well as regular seasonal brews.

data.name: Burton Ale
data.description:
Brewed with English tradition in mind, this copper colored ale is a welcome change to the hop-focused American style of pale ale. A malty, caramel flavor is at the forefront while the finish is of the earthy,
English hop varieties including Fuggles and Kent Goldings. Its balance between malt and hops make it a perfect pairing for many foods ranging from roast chicken, to pork sandwich, to sheppard’s pie.

breweries.name: Manayunk Brewery and Restaurant
breweries.description:
During the 1800's and into the 20th century, Manayunk was known for the manufacture and sales of fine textiles. Krook's Mill, now the Manayunk Brewery and Restaurant, was one of the linchpins of the then booming industry. Anne Dawson opened the mill in 1822 at the mouth of the Manayunk Canal and the Krook family followed with the existing building just short of 100 years later in 1912. A cornerstone from the original mill was placed in the new building. Krook's Mill eventually closed its doors in 1992.

Four years later, Harry Renner IV brought the facility back to life as a space for retail business, a fine eatery, a brewery and as an entertainment complex for both neighbors and visitors alike to enjoy. Our first batch of fresh-brewed beer was tapped on October 17, 1996. In 2000, we expanded our outdoor seating with a deck overlooking the Schuylkill River. In 2003, we added a Stone Pizza Oven and a Sushi Bar to expand our menu selection. Today you can still find the scale, now an antique, that was once used to weigh the wool brought into the factory.

data.name: Burton Ale
data.description: A late 18th century English pale ale. The hard water found around Burton-on-Trent accentuates the malt and hop character. Reddish in color, medium-bodied, slightly fruity and caramelly with a lingering dry, hoppy finish.

breweries.name: Taps Fish House & Brewery
breweries.description:
Brewmaster Victor Novak brews approximately 1700 kegs, or 26,000 gallons of beer for TAPS on an annual basis. His repertoire includes 31 to 35 classic styles of European and American alesand lagers, of which seven are currently on tap, plus one cask ale (see below). Victor also provides two beers for the Manzella family's second restaurant venture, The Catch, in Anaheim.

From the extraordinary leadership of General Manager Chris Snyder, our extraordinary culinary team, the expertise of Brewmaster Victor Novak, to a dedicated wait staff, our people are genuinely passionate about providing exceptional service. With all this going for us, it's not surprising that TAPS has grown into the leading dining destination in Orange County.

data.name: Cambridge Bitter
data.description:
Malty and fruity aroma with a satisfying flavour and bitter finish, Cambridge Bitter is the main brand beer at an ABV of 3.8%.
 
A mild brown bitter with a good balance of malt and hop character give a pleasing session drink. The finest pale ale malt (made from Maris Otter barley) is blended with torrified wheat, invert sugar and a small amount of roast barley, to ensure consistent colour.
 
Hops used are English Fuggles and challenger, a blend that gives a full hop character to the beer.

breweries.name: Elgood's Brewery
breweries.description:
Elgood’s Brewery is a family business established over 200 years ago and run by the Elgood family since 1878. You can find out more about our history here.
 
Today’s Chairman is Nigel Elgood, who ran the brewery as managing director from 1968 to 2002.
 
In that year he handed over the running of the business to the eldest of his three daughters Belinda, who continues as the managing director; while her two sisters Claire and Jennifer are directors. We are very proud of our family history and its association with Elgood’s Brewery.

data.name: Cape May Steve’s Biscuits & Honey
data.description: A truly classic style. Four pounds of local South Jersey honey added per barrel. English yeast an East Kent Goldings hops.

breweries.name: Cape May Brewing Company
breweries.description: We are Cape May County's first and only microbrewery serving South Jersey. Our beers are made in small batches and are hand crafted with the finest ingredients. We are just a small team, in a small warehouse, who share the same vision to make the finest quality beer possible.

data.name: Cask Series #2 - Bitter
data.description: While traditional in British brewing methods, it is nontraditional in ingredients, using German malt and hops. Look for the classic British Bitter characteristics (dry, balanced, tastes like more), but with a German influence. In an era of bigger is better, Notch Bitter shows that subtlety still has merit. It's pretty damn tasty too.

breweries.name: Notch Brewing
breweries.description:
There is a myth born of the craft beer movement that flavorful beer is synonymous with high alcohol. The art of brewing great beer in the US without a debilitating ABV had seemed all but dead. Not anymore. Myths are simply myths, and beers of great flavor and quality have been brewed for hundreds of years in every great brewing nation except ours. Chris is not out to change the US craft beer world, but to simply brew the beers he loves to drink, and he thinks he is not alone.

Chris has been brewing professionally since 1993, first as an apprentice at Kennebunkport Brewing, then at the Tremont Brewery in Boston MA starting in 1994. Today, Chris is an independent brewer – he owns no facility – instead brewing and collaborating with other breweries. He currently brews his beers at two locations, the Ipswich Ale Brewery (Bottles & Draft) and Kennebunkport Brewery (Cask).

data.name: Cask Series #3 - Black Bitter
data.description: It's a strange yet intriguing little beer. Wholly British in every way, yet certainly lacking in any British tradition (to our knowledge, anyway). Think hoppy mild, or dark hoppy bitter. It is certainly not American in any way, as the British hops, malts and yeast dominate this beer, as does the dry finish from sulfate rich brewing water. We almost called this beer Oxymoron (aka Session Black IPA).

data.name: Castle Rock Red Riding Hood
data.description:
Launched at the Robin Hood Beer & Cider Festival 2014, Red Riding Hood is the newest beer in Castle Rock’s core range of beers. A reddish-brown colour, Red Riding Hood bridges the gap between the most traditional of best bitters, and the fruity red ales from the US and beyond. Red Riding Hood is brewed with El Dorado (USA) and Kohatu (NZ), imparting flavours of soft stone fruit.

See: Reddish Brown
Smell: Fresh Hop, Soft Stone Fruit
Taste: Fruity, Subtle Bitterness, Toasted Malt

breweries.name: Castle Rock Brewery
breweries.description:
Castle Rock is a pub and brewing group based in the East Midlands and Yorkshire. It was founded in 1977 by former Campaign for Real Ale (CAMRA) chairman Chris Holmes and its first pub was The Old King’s Arms in Newark.

Named “Pub Group of the Year” in 2002, 2006 and 2008, Castle Rock currently operate 20 pubs and have a policy of stocking cask beers from regional and micro breweries by swapping beer with similar companies.

Castle Rock also operates Nottingham’s largest full mash brewery, which has become firmly established in local and national real beer drinking circles.

Castle Rock produce a range of six regular cask ales and a monthly guest beer in its ‘Natural Selection’ range, created in conjunction with the Wildlife Trusts.

Castle Rock Brewery use only the finest ingredients available to deliver the highest quality real ales to its discerning followers.

data.name: Catoctin Ale
data.description: More amber and less “hoppy” than its American counterpart, plenty of crystal malts create a well balanced finish for our variation on this English style.

breweries.name: Corcoran Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Corcoran Brewing Company was founded in 2011 on the beautiful foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains in Waterford Virginia. This was the second business venture for Corcoran whom had been making award winning wines since 2004. Corcoran which is family owned and operated decided in 2011 to branch out into the hand crafted beer industry. Initially started in a barn on old farmland near Corcoran Vineyards, this combination became Virginia’s first vineyard / brewery combo in the state. After several years of growing business it was realized that there was not enough room to stay as demand for the beer grew. In early 2014 the brewery was moved to Purcellville Virginia which is about 6 miles from where it started.

Corcoran Brewing Company has produced over thirty three distinct beers since opening day. We strive to create both traditional beer types as well as creating unique experiences with experimental beers. On any given day we have twelve beers on tap ranging from Kolch style, American Pale Ales, IPA’s, Imperial IPA’s, Stouts, Bourbon barrel aged, port barrel aged and more. This daily broad selection of quality hand-made craft beers has been a primary reason for our success. Customers can always find a beer that meets their drinking style.

data.name: Christmas Plum Pudding
data.description: At JW Lees, we love Christmas, and cannot wait to get into the festive spirit. For us, Christmas starts at the beginning of December with ‘Plum Pudding Day’, when we dedicate a whole day to our favourite festive beer and celebrate the coming of the Christmas season. Our popular cask ale is full of flavour, and, with plenty of fruity plum - it’s Christmas in a glass. A harmony of Styrian Goldings hops, combined with the flavour of ripe fruit, delivers a delicious taste of candied plum; and a blend of pale ale and crystal malt gives it an intense auburn colour.

breweries.name: Stiegl Brauerei zu Salzburg
breweries.description:
Since 1492, we brew here at our single site brewing beer with the Salzburg best spring water from the nearby Unterberg.

As the largest private brewery in Austria, which is as independent and successful independent family business, we want to continue to be the most popular beer of the Austrians. Therefore, we focus on the art of brewing at the highest level of quality and so consistently.

In order to brew good beer, it requires a lot of brewing experience and the right G'spür in dealing with the raw materials. That's why we talk about the art of brewing!

data.name: Cooper's Cave Pale Ale
data.description: Cooper's Cave Pale Ale is an English Pale Ale throughout.It is a full bodied light colored ale with evenly pronounced hop bitterness. The grain bill consists of two English Pale Malts and an English Crystal Malt. The brewer's favorite...need we say more.

breweries.name: Cooper's Cave Ale Company
breweries.description:
We'd been brewing up beer in the kitchen at home for a few years. In 1995, we were informed that Ed's corporate employer of eleven years was leaving the area (NAFTA). Not wanting to move, and having had enough of the corporate world, we decided to do some research and see what was out there. At that time there were no breweries, brew pubs or microbreweries in our area. A two week vacation to Nova Scotia was inspirational.

It was the comradery of the brewers, owners and staff members that really sold us on the idea of opening our own establishment.The Micro Brewery people we've met have been generous beyond our wildest expectations, with information, how-to, where to find it, etc.

data.name: Cooper's Cave Tavern Ale
data.description: Tavern Ale is a traditional English Bitter, dry bodied and light in color. This sessions ale utilizes Northdown and Kent Golding Hops. Tavern Ale is the creation of Assistant Brewer Adrian Bethel.

data.name: Coopers Sparkling Ale
data.description:
The ale by which all others should be measured. With its famous cloudy sediment and its distinctive balance of malt, hops and fruity characters, the old 'Red Label' is a tasty slice of Coopers history. 

Little has changed since Thomas Cooper produced his first batch of Coopers Sparkling Ale in 1862. It's still brewed naturally using the century old top fermentation method and it still tastes great! 

Sparkling Ale contains no additives or preservatives.

(English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

breweries.name: Coopers Brewery
breweries.description: Coopers Brewery produce a range of Ales,Stouts and Lagers.   Our ale range is brewed by a method of top fermentation, originating in the Middle Ages.  Coopers uses only natural ingredients including malt, hops, sugar, water and a special yeast strain that's over 90 years old.  Coopers do not use preservatives or chemicals in their ale range.   Coopers also produce Stout and Lager beers.  The Lager beers are bottom fermented in cooler conditions, matured for a short period and pasteurised.

data.name: Copper Bitter
data.description: We brewed this one with the summer in mind.  Contrasting to Redoubt red, this brew has a malty backbone with a nice, subtle bitterness that slightly lingers and complements the malt: exactly what a nice drinkable bitter should be.  Also, a nice fruity flavor (from both hops and yeast) presents itself in the background. We used standard English hops and a English style yeast to give this more of an authentic character, not a NW style bitter.  The result is a beer that you will want to drink all day long out on the deck basking in the sun.

style.name: Ordinary Bitter
style.description: Ordinary bitter is gold to copper colored with medium bitterness, light to medium body, and low to medium residual malt sweetness. Hop flavor and aroma character may be evident at the brewer's discretion. Mild carbonation traditionally characterizes draft-cask versions, but in bottled versions, a slight increase in carbon dioxide content is acceptable. Fruity-ester character and very low diacetyl (butterscotch) character are acceptable in aroma and flavor, but should be minimized in this form of bitter. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures. (English and American hop character may be specified in subcategories.)

breweries.name: NW Peaks Brewery
breweries.description: NW Peaks Brewery is a "nano-brewery" located in Ballard. As a nano-brewery, we make less than one barrel of beer per batch and therefore cannot produce nearly the quantity as other breweries around. It also means that we can afford to brew many different styles of beer in smaller quantities with attention to traditional styles and creative "experiments". Instead of having a few flagship beers available at all times, we release two new beers each month. These are only around while they last and then will be supplanted by the next styles in line. You can think about it as brewing only *seasonals* such as a stout or a winter warmer in the winter, a nice malty brown in the fall, or a refreshing kolsch or hefeweizen in the summer. However, the best received ones will get duplicated (but not that often) and quite possibly may become flagship beers down the line.

breweries.name: Copper Canyon Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Lake Havasu City, Arizona's first Nano Brewery. Specializing in Handcrafted Ales and Lagers.

data.name: Copper House Ale
data.description: Our Copper House Ale is an English Style Bitter (but it is not bitter!) with rich flavor and a smooth finish.  The roasted barley gives of a deep flavor throughout the beer and light hop editions counterbalance the sweetness.  The Copper House Ale is a well rounded beer for year round enjoyment.

breweries.name: Rock Harbor Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Welcome to Rock Harbor! We are located right in the heart of Downtown Rockland and serve fresh, high quality food and beverages. Our menu changes seasonally to take advantage of local ingredients and tastes. We have a dining area where customers have a great view of Main Street as well as a cozy horseshoe bar where you can watch all the sports games. We offer special events such as live bands, beer promotions and dinners, and much more! 

We offer a great selection of beer with 16 beers on tap daily, and Dan likes to change it up, so check them out often. We also have a full bar and experienced mixologists to create the perfect drink to suit your mood.

The brewery has been up and running since September. Dan is brewing on a regular basis to keep local, fresh Rock Harbor beer flowing through the taps. Be sure to check out his latest brews and stop in to tour the brewery and learn about the brewing process. He loves chatting about beers and recommending the perfect beer to every customer, so be sure to ask!
All our staff are here to make your dining and drinking experience the best ever. We look forward to serving you! Cheers!

locations.name: Rock Harbor Pub and Brewery - Main Brewery

data.name: Copperopolis
data.description: This beer was made in homage to the Copperopolis bike race in California, a race known to test a man's mettle, just as our new beer will test your mouth's palate. English Pale and Crystal malts with generous additions of Amarillo, Cascade & Columbus hops make this a brewmaster favorite.

breweries.name: Brew Brothers Brewery
breweries.description: Named Best Brewpub in America by Nightclub & Bar magazine, The Brew Brothers offers eight custom microbrews and a creative menu, including gourmet wood-fired pizzas, salads, burgers, ribs, sandwiches, homemade soups and complete dinners. The Brew Brothers Reno brewery was also voted “Best Microbrew, “Best Beer Selection,” and “Best Live Music” in the Best of Reno poll and was named the highest selling brewpub in North America. Catch live bands and DJs nightly.

breweries.name: Wells and Young's Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Wells and Young's Brewing Company is the epitome of all-round business excellence, demonstrating sustained growth for its beers and stockists whilst combining traditional family values with innovation and development. 

Firmly placed as the UK's largest private brewing company, it is fiercely independent, and with an enviable portfolio of some of the UK's most loved cask beers and speciality lager brands.

data.name: Custers Last Ale
data.description:
This beer is an English pale ale, full bodied and copper colored. The hop flavor and aroma are strong and assertive. Caramel malt and English yeast produce a nutty and fruity character. Dry-hopping in the conditioning phase completes the package. Custer’s Last Ale has an alcohol content of 6.0%.

Great American Beer Festival 1996 – Silver, 2000 – Gold, 2001 – Gold, 2003 – Bronze
World Beer Cup 2004 – Silver
North American Brewers Fest 2003 – Gold

breweries.name: Snake River Brewing
breweries.description:
America's most award-winning small brewery since 1994 offering a wide array of lagers and ales with hand-crafted cuisine. Locals and tourists alike co-mingle in a friendly and casual environment.

Make yourself at home at Snake River Brewing in the heart of the Teton Mountain Range. All roads, trails, bike paths, climbing routes and ski runs lead to “The Brewpub”! After a day in the great outdoors how can you not partake of a tasty malt beverage and a delicious meal

data.description: A tawny coloured ale with a mixture of Kentish hops that gives a balanced aroma and aftertaste.

breweries.name: Nelson Brewery
breweries.description:
The brewery was first brought to the Historic Dockyard at Chatham as the Flagship Brewery in 1995 where it established a five barrel kit brewing up to 100 firkins a week. All the ales have nautical themed names to gel with the surroundings in which it is brewed


In 2003 the brewery was bought and renamed the Nelson Brewing Company to fall in line with the most famous naval hero of all time 'Admiral Horatio Nelson' and that his flagship 'The Victory' was built here in Chatham Dockyard.

In July 2006 the brewery was purchased by Piers Macdonald. Piers has over 20 years experience in the brewing industry and is passionate to keep the traditions of Kent brewing alive. Using the best ingredients and the finest Kent hops, combined with the expertise and dedication of his brewing staff, Piers plans to build on the brewery's already growing reputation as the provider of some of the tastiest ales on the market.

Now brewing from a seven and a half barrel kit and regularly having over a dozen ales of various strengths and taste available, the brewery is sure to have a beer to suit all!

data.name: Cutthroat Pale Ale
data.description: This traditional style pale ale has a rich amber color, full malt body and a clean hop finish.

breweries.name: Uinta Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Named after the only major east-west running mountain range located in the continental U.S., Uinta Brewing Company's journey began in 1993 with the reality that passion for craft beer and a hankering for the great outdoors could align in Salt Lake City, UT.
 
Built on an axis point that endorses sustainability, community involvement and innovation, their compass guides them on a path to admirable, consistent craft beer leading consumers to discover a brand with passion, personality and soul.  Precisely, GREAT BEER is Uinta's True North.

breweries.name: Abbeydale Brewery
breweries.description:
We are proud to be a successful small business in and from Sheffield.

We were lucky enough to get in on the ground floor of the revival of craft beer, and canny enough to grow continually throughout our existence.

We have established Moonshine as a very popular local beer and all of our regular and special beers have a following somewhere - sometimes in the most unusual places!

We have one pub of our own, The Rising Sun in Nether Green, Sheffield where you can always try one (or more!) of at least six of our beers that are always on show alongside up to seven beers from other small breweries. Nearly all of these are sourced by swapping with like-minded brewers, proving that we like to share our love for all things beer related.

data.name: Dan's Best Bitter
data.description:
An English pint shared with good friends was the inspiration for our cask conditioned Best Bitter. Dan flew in yeast from England and chose premium British Maris Otter Pale Malt to be balance the classic English Golding Hops from East Kent. 

You can expect to pour a lightly carbonated glass of rich amber ale, slightly cloudy and soft on the pallet with a pronounced dry hopped finish. 

Summer's end is fleeting here in Wisconsin so enjoy it while you may, before long both summer and our ale will be gone. So slow down, relax and savor the season.

breweries.name: New Glarus Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welcome to our quaint little brewery nestled on the outskirts of New Glarus, Wisconsin. The brewery is run by an enthusiastic couple, Daniel & Deb Carey, who have successfully combined business management and brewing professionalism. Our philosophy is based on individuality, cooperation and the employment of 100% natural ingredients to produce world -class, handcrafted beers for our friends in Wisconsin. Cheers!

data.name: Darkwood Ale
data.description:
Our flagship ale based on a traditional English Bitter style but with a local twist.

Brewed with Maris Otter malted barley and a variety of crystal malts with generous additions of Northdown, Goldings and Cascade hops.

breweries.name: Bellingen Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Situated on the mid north coast near Coffs  Harbour  the  Bellingen Brewing Company has been in operation since 2005 and specializes in producing a small range of hand crafted ales using only the finest quality malted barley and hops.

No additives or preservatives –this is real beer as it should be!

breweries.name: Fish Brewing Company
breweries.description: From our home in beautiful Olympia, Washington, Fish Brewing Company has been hand-crafting ales of Northwest proportions since 1993. Then, using a system cobbled from brewing and dairy equipment, we brewed for our neighbors up and down Puget Sound. Growing steadily since, Fish is now an award-winning craft brewer with distribution throughout the Pacific Northwest and beyond.

breweries.name: Titletown Brewing
breweries.description: Titletown Brewing Co was founded in 1996 inside the historic Chicago Northwestern Train Depot in the heart of Green Bay, WI.  The brewpub is open year-round serving unique, hand-crafted dishes, fresh "honest" pints, and hand made Sno-Cap Root Beer.  Titletown's Beerworks production brewery was completed in 2014, bottling award winning beers just footsteps from the existing brewpub.

data.name: Doombar
data.description: Doom Bar bitter (4.0% abv), the brewery's flagship ale, accounts for nearly 90% of sales. Over 24,000,000 imperial pints (14,000 kl) of Doom Bar was produced in 2010. In 2011, sales increased by 22 per cent, making it the UK's fastest growing ale for three years in a row. The beer is named after the notoriously dangerous Doom Bar sandbank at the mouth of the Camel Estuary in North Cornwall.

breweries.name: Sharp's
breweries.description: Sharp's Brewery was founded in 1994 at Rock, Cornwall. The success and growth of our young Brewery has been phenomenal with Sharp's now the largest brewer of cask conditioned beer in the South West ( Industry sources) and Sharp's flagship brand Doom Bar is the No. 1 Cask Beer in the UK*.

data.name: Doppel Bock
data.description:
A mighty lager-style brew, dark in color. Our Doppelbock brings a big malty sweetness together with the classic lager smoothness, topped off with a slightly evident alcohol flavor. A toasty brew to battle even the coldest winter nights.

Available at the Brewery and in bottles & cases from March - May.

breweries.name: Lancaster Brewing Company
breweries.description: We brew our beer in the heart of Lancaster County, Pennsylvania with great respect for the old traditions of brewing. Our master brewer, Christian Heim, has a strong commitment to quality and uses advanced brewing techniques to produce a consistent and high quality beer. Savor the hopped aromas as they come alive and accentuate the wholesome malt flavors in our ales and lagers.

breweries.name: Hereford & Hops Restaurant and Brewpub
breweries.description: Hereford and Hops opened in downtown Escanaba, on the first floor of a historic 1914 five-story former hotel. The restored building has two dining rooms, a pub and two brick open grills. Since 1994 Hereford and Hops has specialized in a do-it-yourself style of dining with the choice to grill your own steak, seafood or chicken. With grill chefs on duty, you can always choose to have your entrée professionally grilled.

breweries.name: Southampton Publick House
breweries.description: The word about the quality of our beer began to get around the metro New York region as soon as we turned on the spigots and started to serve it in our Southampton restaurant. Almost from day one, leading restaurants, pubs and taverns have requested our crafted brews for  their own patrons. Our Brewmaster, Phil Markowski  has personally directed the flow of our ales and lagers into the finest outlets. Our Mission is to offer a wide variety of specialty ales and lagers.  Our small batch brews range from classic farmhouse styles to traditional sessions beers to be enjoyed year-round.

data.name: Dragon’s Fire
data.description: A perfect beer when celebrating any patriotic events including bank holidays, Easter, St George’s day and St David’s day. This all-malt cask ale with a citrus aftertaste is guaranteed to put some fire in your belly, and make you proud to celebrate all things British!

data.name: Drayman’s Reward
data.description: As summer draws to a close and those cold winter nights start to set in, our draymen are still hard at work, ensuring that our much loved beer is always there to be enjoyed. The perfect pint to mark the importance of our draymen, The Drayman’s Reward is our sign of recognition to all of our hard working dray’s. Nothing soothes the burn on the hands after a hard day’s work quite like gripping a pint of Drayman’s Reward. The Drayman’s Reward is an enjoyable full bodied ale, brewed with Brewer’s Gold hops to deliver rich flavours that give this bitter its clear-cut flavour. So raise a glass to the draymen this year with the Drayman’s Reward.
